p: Previous research reported that geraniol exhibited good antimicrobial activity and, in combination with antibiotics, would have substantial therapeutic potential against S. aureus and E. coli infections [ 60]. Although geraniol and nerol are geometric isomers, they demonstrated equal activities [ 61]. Taking into account the moderate antibacterial activity against S. aureus and E. coli, EOs of T. vulgaris (with geraniol and nerol) could be used as herbal supplements to conventional therapy.
